title: HGUTheme
text: many ways representing colours whilst coding, one common method use package (widely used R) hex codes. , “hex” short “hexadecimal”, number system uses numbers 0-9 well letters -F (info ). colour can represented hex character string starting # followed 6 characters either 0-9 -F. common hex colours: Black: #000000 White: #FFFFFF Red: #FF0000 Green: #00FF00 Blue: #0000FF Gold: #FFD700 Silver: #C0C0C0 Bronze: #967444 Rather remember codes, HGUThemes functions remember useful ones . prominent colours MRC HGU Powerpoint template three shades blue present logo bottom left (well default colours text box text shapes). three colours hex: Dark Blue: #2D2E5F Mid Blue: #3A88A9 Light Blue: #00BAD2 Rather writing , can access using HGUTheme functions: can useful quickly colouring ggplot2 plots, lets make quick example. fairly common plot might make scientist scatter plot trend putting linear regression line top. First can make fake data can make simple plot might make presentation:  points black, linear regression line red reference line y = x blue. code can see used already built presets set colours elements using colour names (e.g. "blue"). wanted set colour parts plots MRC HGU logo can replace hex code functions (supply hex code instead).  may want go colours, done , shows concept can use functions quickly access hex codes MRC HGU colour theme use wherever accept colour.
code: # MRC HGU Dark Blue hgu_dark() #> [1] "#2D2E5F" # MRC HGU Mid Blue hgu_mid() #> [1] "#3A88A9" # MRC HGU Light Blue hgu_light() #> [1] "#54BBD2" plot_data <- tibble(   x = runif(100),   y = x + rnorm(100, 0, 0.2) ) plot_data #> # A tibble: 100 × 2 #>         x       y #>     <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1 0.0237  0.0318 #>  2 0.294   0.325  #>  3 0.744   0.538  #>  4 0.945   1.06   #>  5 0.0781 -0.0895 #>  6 0.825   0.784  #>  7 0.896   0.753  #>  8 0.137   0.585  #>  9 0.0147  0.0177 #> 10 0.928   1.15   #> # … with 90 more rows ggplot(   data = plot_data,   mapping = aes(x = x, y = y) ) +   # Adding a y = x line   geom_abline(     intercept = 0, # Setting the intercept of the line to 0     slope = 1, # Setting the slope of the line to 1     linetype = 2, # Setting the line to be dashed     size = 1.5, # Setting the line to be slightly thicker than default (default is 1)     colour = "blue" # Setting the colour of the line to blue   ) +   # Adding a scatter plot   geom_point(     colour = "black" # Setting the colour of the points to black (black is the default)   ) +   # Adding linear regression line   geom_smooth(     method = "lm", # Setting the method to calculate the line to linear regression     se = FALSE, # Removing the standard error bars     colour = "red" # Setting the colour of the line to red   ) +   theme_bw() + # Adding a black and white theme   # Adding labels to the plot   labs(     title = "Comparing X and Y", # Setting the title     caption = "Blue dashed line shows 1:1 relationship" # Setting the caption   ) ggplot(   data = plot_data,   mapping = aes(x = x, y = y) ) +   # Adding a y = x line   geom_abline(     intercept = 0, # Setting the intercept of the line to 0     slope = 1, # Setting the slope of the line to 1     linetype = 2, # Setting the line to be dashed     size = 1.5, # Setting the line to be slightly thicker than default (default is 1)     colour = hgu_mid() # Setting the colour of the line to blue   ) +   # Adding a scatter plot   geom_point(     colour = hgu_dark() # Setting the colour of the points to black (black is the default)   ) +   # Adding linear regression line   geom_smooth(     method = "lm", # Setting the method to calculate the line to linear regression     se = FALSE, # Removing the standard error bars     colour = hgu_light() # Setting the colour of the line to red   ) +   theme_bw() + # Adding a black and white theme   # Adding labels to the plot   labs(     title = "Comparing X and Y", # Setting the title     caption = "Blue dashed line shows 1:1 relationship" # Setting the caption   )

title: HGUTheme
text: common cases want apply certain colour themes ggplot2 plot. save time, coded supplied part package. obvious example three column bar chart:  case, colour giving information plot changing colours aesthetic change affect message plot. three different “classes” (represented x-axis) can colour using fill.  Just adding class fill aesthetic colours plot using default ggplot2 colour theme, fitting powerpoint theme can look rather “garish”. can quickly add MRC HGU theme using function scale_fill_hgu3() (also use guides function remove colour legend necessary).  3 scale_fill_hgu3 stands 3 colour, making similar plot 2 colours scale_fill_hgu2 can used instead  default, uses darkest lightest blues, can quickly changed using similar scale_fill_hgu2_*_* functions. example, use mid blue (mid) light blue (high) two colours plot, scale_fill_hgu2_mid_light function can used instead  examples colour used aesthetic purposes. Please careful conveying information using colours can make confusing plots, expecially people colourblind related conditions. example, scatter plot appropriate use colours.  hard anyone tell difference colours. vein, HGUTheme provides gradient functions used colour plots continuous variable. example  Although functions supplied (mostly completeness) much clearer use theme supplied viridis package
code: plot_data <- tibble(   class = c("A", "B", "C"),   value = c(0.5, 0.3, 0.2) ) plot_data #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   class value #>   <chr> <dbl> #> 1 A       0.5 #> 2 B       0.3 #> 3 C       0.2 ggplot(   data = plot_data,   aes(x = class, y = value) ) +   # Adding column plot   geom_col() +   theme_bw() # Adding a black and white theme ggplot(   data = plot_data,   aes(x = class, y = value, fill = class) ) +   # Adding column plot   geom_col() +   theme_bw() # Adding a black and white theme ggplot(   data = plot_data,   aes(x = class, y = value, fill = class) ) +   # Adding column plot   geom_col() +   theme_bw() + # Adding a black and white theme   guides(fill = "none") + # Removing the legend for the fill colours   scale_fill_hgu3() # Adding the MRC HGU colour theme plot_data <- tibble(   class = c("A", "B"),   value = c(0.6, 0.4) )  ggplot(   data = plot_data,   aes(x = class, y = value, fill = class) ) +   # Adding column plot   geom_col() +   theme_bw() + # Adding a black and white theme   guides(fill = "none") + # Removing the legend for the fill colours   scale_fill_hgu2() # Adding the MRC HGU colour theme ggplot(   data = plot_data,   aes(x = class, y = value, fill = class) ) +   # Adding column plot   geom_col() +   theme_bw() + # Adding a black and white theme   guides(fill = "none") + # Removing the legend for the fill colours   scale_fill_hgu2_mid_high() # Adding the MRC HGU colour theme plot_data <- tibble(   x = runif(100),   y = runif(100),   colour = rep(c("A", "B"), 50) )  ggplot(   data = plot_data,   mapping = aes(x = x, y = y, colour = colour) ) +   geom_point() + # Creating scatter plot   theme_classic() + # Adding the classic theme   scale_colour_hgu2_mid_high() + # Adding the mid and light blue MRC HGU colour theme   # Adding title   labs(     title = "An **Inappropriate** Use Of The Colour Palette"   ) plot_data <- tibble(   x = rnorm(100000),   y = rnorm(100000) )  ggplot(   data = plot_data,   mapping = aes(x = x, y = y) ) +   geom_hex(bins = 40) + # Adding density plot   theme_classic() + # Setting the theme to classic   scale_fill_gradient_hgu() # Adding the MRC HGU colour theme gradient ggplot(   data = plot_data,   mapping = aes(x = x, y = y) ) +   geom_hex(bins = 40) + # Adding density plot   theme_classic() + # Setting the theme to classic   scale_fill_viridis_c() # Adding a colourblind friendly theme from viridis

code: @Manual{,   title = {HGUTheme: Unofficial ggplot2 For The HGU},   author = {Hugh Warden and Jesko Wagner},   year = {2022},   note = {https://hwarden162.github.io/HGUTheme/, https://github.com/hwarden162/HGUTheme}, }

title: Unofficial ggplot2 For The HGU
text: Unofficial ggplot2 themes using colour palette MRC HGU logo. MRC Human Genetics Unit Powerpoint template comes preset colour theme controls colours elements presentation. creating plot ggplot2 possible set colour various parts various elements HGUTheme contains multiple functions help . always appropriate use colours (discussed ‘Get started’) appropriate HGUTheme allows easily create consistent colour theme presentations. palettes created align colour schemes MRC HGU palettes. However, original palettes designed use plots please consider effect colour choices colourblind people constructing plots.

title: Unofficial ggplot2 For The HGU
text: can install development version HGUTheme GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("hwarden162/HGUTheme")

title: Unofficial ggplot2 For The HGU
text: colour assigned function return character string corresponding HEX code. example: grouped palettes also stored functions: users’ convenience, various functions written set colour values basic plot data look like  layer can added change fill boxes match MRC HGU powerpoint theme
code: hgu_dark() #> [1] "#2D2E5F" hgu_palette() #> [1] "#2D2E5F" "#3A88A9" "#54BBD2" plot_data <- tibble(   class = c("A", "B", "C"),   value = c(0.5,0.3,0.2) ) plot_data #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   class value #>   <chr> <dbl> #> 1 A       0.5 #> 2 B       0.3 #> 3 C       0.2 plot_data %>%   ggplot(aes(x = class, y = value, fill = class)) +   geom_col() +   theme_classic() plot_data %>%   ggplot(aes(x = class, y = value, fill = class)) +   geom_col() +   theme_classic() +   scale_fill_hgu3()

what: Scale Colours With A Gradient — scale_colour_gradient2_hgu
title: Scale Colours With A Gradient — scale_colour_gradient2_hgu
text: Scale Colours Gradient

title: Scale Colours With A Gradient — scale_colour_gradient2_hgu
code: scale_colour_gradient2_hgu(   ...,   low = hgu_dark(),   mid = hgu_mid(),   high = hgu_light(),   midpoint = 0,   space = "Lab",   na.value = mrc_grey(),   guide = "colourbar",   aesthetics = "colour" )

title: Scale Colours With A Gradient — scale_colour_gradient2_hgu
text: ... Arguments passed . low Colour low end gradient. mid Colour midpoit gradient. high Colour high end gradient. midpoint midpoint (data value) diverging scale. Defaults 0. space Colour space calculate gradient. na.value Colour used missing values. guide Type legend. aesthetics aesthetic apply scale .

title: Scale Colours With A Gradient — scale_colour_gradient2_hgu
text: layer can added ggplot2 object.

title: Scale Colours With A Gradient — scale_colour_gradient2_hgu
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(   data = data.frame(x = runif(100), y = runif(100)),   mapping = aes(x = x, y = y, colour = x) ) +   geom_point() + theme_classic() +   scale_colour_gradient2_hgu(midpoint = 0.5)

code: scale_colour_hgu2(   ...,   values = c(hgu_dark(), hgu_light()),   aesthetics = "colour",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = mrc_grey() )

title: Assign Discrete HGU 2 Colour Palette — scale_colour_hgu2
text: ... Arguments passed . values character vector colour values map data . aesthetics aesthetic apply scale . breaks Values beaks (see ggplot2::scale_colour_manual details). na.value Colour used missing values.

code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(   data = data.frame(x = runif(60), y = runif(60), colour = rep(c("A", "B"), 30)),   mapping = aes(x = x, y = y, colour = colour) ) +   geom_point() + theme_classic() +   scale_colour_hgu2()

code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(   data = data.frame(x = rnorm(10000), y = rnorm(10000)),   mapping = aes(x = x, y = y) ) +   geom_hex(bins = 40) + theme_classic() +   scale_fill_gradient_hgu()

title: HGUTheme 0.0.1
text: HGUTheme v0.0.1 released Functions colour codes palette codes added. Functions discrete HGU blues added. Functions continuous HGU blues added. Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Created pkgdown documentation. Added ‘Getting started’ vignette.
